column3: The CONCAT commandconcatenates two or morestrings into a single string.
column4: SELECT CONCAT(string1,string2,) ASconcatenated_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECT CONCAT(first_name,' ', last_name) ASfull_name FROM employees;

column3: The SUBSTRING commandextracts a substring from astring.
column4: SELECT SUBSTRING(stringFROM start_position [FORlength]) AS substringFROM table_name;
column5: SELECTSUBSTRING(product_nameFROM 1 FOR 5) ASsubstring FROM products;

column3: The LENGTH command returnsthe length (number ofcharacters) of a string.
column4: SELECTCHAR_LENGTH(string) ASlength FROM table_name;
column5: SELECTCHAR_LENGTH(product_name)AS length FROM products;

column3: The UPPER command convertsall characters in a string touppercase.
column4: SELECT UPPER(string) ASuppercase_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECT UPPER(first_name)AS uppercase_first_nameFROM employees;

column3: The LOWER command convertsall characters in a string tolowercase.
column4: SELECT LOWER(string) ASlowercase_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECT LOWER(last_name)AS lowercase_last_nameFROM employees;

column3: The TRIM command removesspecified prefixes or suffixes (orwhitespace by default) from astring.
column4: SELECT TRIM([LEADING |TRAILING | BOTH]characters FROM string)AS trimmed_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECT TRIM(TRAILING ' 'FROM full_name) AStrimmed_full_name FROMcustomers;

column3: The LEFT command returns aspecified number of charactersfrom the left of a string.
column4: SELECT LEFT(string,num_characters) ASleft_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECTLEFT(product_name, 5)AS left_product_nameFROM products;

column3: The RIGHT command returns aspecified number of charactersfrom the right of a string.
column4: SELECT RIGHT(string,num_characters) ASright_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECTRIGHT(order_number, 4) ASright_order_number FROMorders;

column3: The REPLACE commandreplaces occurrences of asubstring within a string.
column4: SELECT REPLACE(string,old_substring,new_substring) ASreplaced_string FROMtable_name;
column5: SELECTREPLACE(description,'old_string','new_string') ASreplaced_description FROMproduct_descriptions;
